contentrichtext.text: {{wikt}} '''Pacifica''' (meaning ''calm'', or ''peaceful'') may refer to: {{TOCright}} ==Art== * [[Pacifica (statue)|''Pacifica'' (statue)]], an eight-story feminine figure built in 1938 by Ralph Stackpole for the Golden Gate International Exposition ==Places== * [[Pacifica, California]], a city in the United States ** [[Pacifica Pier]], a fishing pier * [[Pacifica High School (Oxnard, California)]] ==Media== * [[Pacifica Radio]], a non-commercial radio network in the United States, founded on the principles of pacifism * ''[[Federal Communications Commission v. Pacifica Foundation]]'', a landmark court case for the regulation of indecency in U.S. broadcasting * ''Pacifica'', a newsletter published by the [[Association of Pacific Coast Geographers]] * [[Pacifica (journal)]], theological journal ==Music== * [[Pacifica (album)|''Pacifica'' (album)]], by Fred Frith * [[Pacifica (The Presets album)]], an album by [[The Presets]] * [[Yamaha Pacifica]], a model of electric guitar * [[Pacifica Quartet]], an American string quartet ==Fictional== * [[Pacifica (Star Trek)]], a fictional planet * [[List of Scrapped Princess characters#Pacifica Casull|Pacifica Casull]], a character in the ''[[Scrapped Princess]]'' anime * Pacifica, a fictional state in the [[Crimson Skies]] universe * Pacifica, a fictional state in the video game [[Shattered Union]] * Pacifica, a bonus world in the Game Boy Advance version of ''[[Donkey Kong Country 3: Dixie Kong's Double Trouble!]]'' * Pacifica, a fictional nation that rivals the eastern alliance in the video game [[Fracture (video game)|Fracture]] * Pacifica, a fictional underwater city in the TV series ''[[Stingray (TV series)|Stingray]]'' * Pacifica, a fictional [[Microsoft Flight Simulator X#Airlines|airline in Flight Simulator X]] * Pacifica, a fictional underwater city in the 1971 TV movie ''[[City Beneath the Sea (1971 film)|City Beneath The Sea]]'' ==Other uses== * [[Chrysler Pacifica]], a crossover sport utility vehicle * ''[[Gavia pacifica]]'', a species of loon * Pacifica, a division of French insurance company [[CrÃ©dit Agricole]] * Pacifica, the codename for computer x86 virtualization technology from AMD, currently known as [[AMD-V]] * [[Pacifica Graduate Institute]], an educational institution offering degrees in psychology, mythological studies, and the humanities * [[Pacifica Forum]], a controversial discussion group based in [[Eugene, Oregon]] * [[Pacifica Engineering, Inc.]], a [[Seattle]] based engineering company * [[Pacifica Marine]], a Seattle based transport vehicles manufacturer and refurbisher == See also == * [[Pasifika (disambiguation)]] * [[Pacifika]] (music group) {{disambig}}
